TOP EMITTERS
-If we examine the top CO2 emitters for 2017. We can see that China tops the list followed by the United States and EU.

- But this is just one side of the story
COLLECTIVE CONTRIBUTION
- On closely examining the percentage contribution of China, US and EU, we came to know that their collective contribution to the CO2 emission is more than 50%. And this followed by emerging giants like India and Russia while others contribution around 37%.

- This means that even though China may be the leader in CO2 emission but the contribution of other countries cannot be neglected.

SOLUTION
- The developed countries should start reducing their CO2 emissions and the rest of the world will follow

- Low carbon technology should be cheap and available, since this will reduce the developing countries' dependence on fossil fuels

- Climate change is a global problem and no country alone can fix it

- So who's responsible is not a simple question as it seems, it is a daft question
